prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We propose a 12CO(3-2) line observation with this science goal. We set a spectral window around 107.0575 GHz, which is center frequency of 12CO(3-2) from z = 2.23. Therefore, we can cover the redshift range of z = 2.200 - 2.287 with 4 GHz band width. The CO line width (FWHM) emitted by dusty star-forming galaxies is typically wider than a few 100 km/s, therefore our request is sufficient.

We detect these sources as the point sources. The 1.0" resolution corresponds to ~8 kpc in physical at z=2.23. The known SMGs has their typical size ~5 kpc (Biggs & Ivison 2008), we can expect significant detection in this resolution. The FoV of band 3 is largher than fwhm of any SPIRE bands, so only one pointing is needed.

We aim > 5-sigma detections of a 12CO(3-2) line with a velocity resolution of 100 km/s. The CO luminosity is derived from the FIR luminosity of targets, which is estimated from SPIRE 250, 350, 500 um flux density with best fitted single grey body radiation. We assume the redshift of z=2.23 for all targets. We require 1-sigma RMS for 2QZ-SPIRE-4 (L_FIR is 5.0*10^12 L_sun) which is the faintest source in our targets. We use the L_FIR-L_CO(3-2) relation, logL_CO(3-2)=0.93logL_FIR-1.50 (Iono et al. 2012). Then the estimated peak flux density is 1.8 mJy for 2QZ-SPIRE-4. Therefore, we need 1 sigma = 360 uJy to achieve 5-sigma detection for 2QZ-SPIRE-4. For the others souces, we can expect > 5-sigma detections. The continuum flux is calculated from 500 um flux density by assuming Rayleigh-Jeans Law.

We propose a 12CO(4-3) line observation with this science goal. We set a spectral window around 142.73715 GHz, which is center frequency of 12CO(4-3) from z = 2.23. Therefore, we can cover the redshift range of z = 2.170 - 2.291 with 4 GHz band width. The CO line width (FWHM) emitted by dusty star-forming galaxies is typically wider than a few 100 km/s, therefore our request is sufficient.

We detect these sources as the point sources. The 1.0" resolution corresponds to ~8 kpc in physical at z=2.23. The known SMGs has their typical size ~5 kpc (Biggs & Ivison 2008), we can expect significant detection in this resolution. The FoV of band 4 is largher than fwhm of any SPIRE bands, so only one pointing is needed.

We aim > 5-sigma detections of a 12CO(4-3) line with a velocity resolution of 100 km/s. The CO luminosity is derived from the FIR luminosity of targets, which is estimated from SPIRE 250, 350, 500 um flux density with best fitted single grey body radiation. We assume the redshift of z=2.23 for all targets. We require 1-sigma RMS for 2QZ-SPIRE-4 (L_FIR is 5.0*10^12 L_sun) which is the faintest source in our targets. We use the L_FIR-L_CO(3-2) relation, logL_CO(3-2)=0.93logL_FIR-1.50 (Iono et al. 2012). After that, we calculate L_CO(4-3) with conversion of L_CO(3-2)/L_CO(4-3)=1.43 (Carilli & Walter 2013). Then the estimated peak flux density is 2.2 mJy for 2QZ-SPIRE-4. Therefore, we need 1 sigma = 440 uJy to achieve 5-sigma detection for 2QZ-SPIRE-4. For the others souces, we can expect > 5-sigma detections. The continuum flux is calculated from 500 um flux density by assuming Rayleigh-Jeans Law.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We search for 12CO(4-3) and 12CO(3-2) lines of 6 dusty star-forming galaxies in the 2QZ cluster at z=2.23 with ALMA band 4 and band 3. In Matsuda et al. (2011) we discovered the amazing large-scale structure of Ha emitters (HAEs) associated with the concentration of 4 bright QSOs on its peak (the ``2QZ'' cluster).
Recently we have further identified a strong concentration of the Herschel/SPIRE sources just adjacent to the HAE density peak. Something must be going on near the HAEs density peak of 2QZ cluster, suggesting this protocluster could be experiencing both dusty enhanced star-formation and AGN activities compared with field environment at the same epoch.
However, because the SPIRE color selection has a redshift uncertainty, we require spectroscopic observations. This proposal allows us to confirm the dusty enhanced star-formation activities (several 1000 M_sun/yr) with its z=0 cluster halo mass > 10^15 M_sun and the quantities of molecular gas contents.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
